attributes.action: curtail the introduction of e-voting into the democratic process and impose a moratorium on the project.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Fast and loose, again...

Despite having had ample opportunity to learn from global experience, the government is recklessly running e-voting pilots without any systematic audit, testing and certification processes in place. Nor will there be any meaningful oversight by technically competent bodies. In its precipitate haste to meet a self-imposed deadline (May 2007), the government has ignored calls both from The Electoral Commission and from its own vendors to allow more time for implementation.

E-voting introduces new risks and uncertainties, and may provide opportunities for fraud with the introduction of a unproven technology - “A secure internet voting system is theoretically possible, but it would be the first secured networked application ever created in the history of computers”, Bruce Schneier.

For more see: openrightsgroup.org
